Directions

Learning objective:
Understand how divergence of velocity is related to mass balance.

How to use the simulation:
The simulation shows a vector plot of five velocity profiles. Use the list on the left to select a profile. Move the 2 x 2 box by adjusting the x-center and y-center sliders. The numbers next to each side show the net flow rate through that face: positive indicates flow out of the box and negative indicates flow into the box.

Notation:
Each velocity profile uses \(\hat{\mathbf{e}}_x\) and \(\hat{\mathbf{e}}_y\) to denote unit vectors pointing in the positive x and y directions, respectively. The divergence of a two-dimensional velocity field \(\vec{v} = u\,\hat{\mathbf{e}}_x + v\,\hat{\mathbf{e}}_y\) is \(\nabla \cdot \vec{v} = \partial u / \partial x + \partial v / \partial y\).

Quantitative understanding:
Compute the divergence of each of the five profiles and verify that the inflow and outflow rates balance whenever the divergence is zero.
